pages.text:
About
Home
»
About
About
MastrysBrewingCo
2024-08-20T14:14:58+00:00
History
Jump To:
History
/
FAQs
/
In the News
The Beginning of the Brewery
Mastry’s Brewing Co. started off as an inspired vision led and fueled by a passion to build.
In January of 2015, the Mastry’s operation began as a nano-brewery within a family member’s Italian restaurant in the Tyrone area of St. Pete. After over a year, the next step was searching for the perfect location for the brick and mortar microbrewery.
In August of 2016, Mastry’s Brewing Co. opened its doors as the first microbrewery in St. Pete Beach!
Mastry’s is an iconic name, and the family has deep roots in the area, including a well-known bait and tackle shop, a popular neighborhood bar located in downtown St. Pete, and an engine and marine center.
The Mastry’s Family Name
Our owner and CEO, Matthew Dahm, was inspired to open the brewery by both his love of great beer and as a tribute to his family – especially his grandmother, Juliet Mastry.
Matthew, being a third generation Mastry, decided to name the brewery after his grandmother’s family to pay homage and continue to contribute to the family’s renown throughout the Tampa Bay area.
The wedding of John & Asma Mastry, circa 1908 (Great-grandparents of Matthew Dahm)
John & Asma Mastry family photo, circa 1934. Juliet Mastry is seated in the front row, second from right. Taken on the lawn of the original Vinoy Hotel.
Remembering Juliet
Out of a family of 10 children, Juliet was the only sibling to leave her home in St Petersburg, when she decided to pursue her dream as a professional stage singer in New York City,  and later a restaurateur of the original Mastry’s Restaurant in NYC.
Juliet returned home to St. Petersburg in 1976, and lived to the ripe age of 96 before passing away in December 2017.
Juliet Mastry – professional headshot, circa 1941.
Mastry’s Brewing Co Today!
Our co-owners and co-founders are Matthew Dahm and Danie Dahm. Both Florida natives who were inspired by their hardworking and entrepreneurial parents who built their own businesses from the ground up.
Avid craft beer fans, they began their own craft beer endeavor with Matthew home-brewing on weekends while Danie worked on her doctorate degree. Today, Matthew and Dr. Danie continue their passion for brewing excellent beer and contributing to the local St. Pete and St. Pete Beach community.
Matt and Danie Dahm, owners of Mastry’s Brewing Co.
Come have a beer with us soon!  Check out what’s
on tap
now!
FAQs
Q: What kind of beers do you offer?
A:
We have a rotating selection of a wide variety of ales, lagers, sours, IPAs, ciders, and more!  Check out our current tap list here.
Q:  Do you offer free parking?
A:
Yes!  We have nine parking spots in our private lot (including one e-vehicle plugin, and one accessible spot), as well as open street parking on 77th Avenue in St Pete Beach.
Q:  Are you pet-friendly?
A:
Absolutely! We love well-behaved pets on our outdoor patio and biergarten. Let our staff know if you’d like some fresh water for your pup.
Q:  Are you near public transportation?
A:
Yes, we’re only an easy 5-minute walk from the SunRunner bus stops #8003/#2403 (corner of Boca Ciega Drive and 75th Avenue in St Pete Beach). We also have a security rack for those who arrive via e-bike or bicycle! We also partner with FreeBeachRide.com for anyone visiting the beach without a vehicle.
Q:  Do you have options for people with food allergies/sensitivities?
A:
We absolutely do!  Our Kitchen at Mastry’s has vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, and dairy-free options!  Please let our staff know ahead of time about any allergies or sensitivities, and we’ll do the best we can to accommodate your request.
Q:  Do you deliver food?
A:
Yes, we partner with both DoorDash and UberEats for delivery in St Pete Beach.  Search for Mastry’s Brewing on either platform to order your food for delivery.
Q:  Do you have WiFi?
A:
Of course we do!  Check out the menu board in our tasting room for the password, or ask a staff member.
Q:  Can I bring my children?
A:
Yes! We are a family-friendly brewery. We have a video game system, a selection of board/family games on our patio. However, we are located on a busy street in St Pete Beach, so please keep a close eye on your kiddos to ensure their safety.
Q:  Can I smoke cigars or cigarettes at the brewery?
A:
Yes, we offer a curated selection of cigars in the tasting room. Ask a staff member for assistance selecting one, or bring your own!
Please note:
For the comfort of all other guests, please remain near the outer edge of the biergarten or patio (smoking is not allowed in the taproom or other sections of the building).
Q:  What organizations do you belong to?
A:
Plenty!
Tampa Bay Beaches Chamber
,
Visit St Pete/Clearwater
,
Florida Brewers Guild
,
Brewers Association
,
USF Alumni Association
, plus we’re listed on
Creative Loafing
,
Tripadvisor
,
Yelp
,
Google
, and more!
Q:  Can I host a special event at Mastry’s Brewing Co?
A:
You sure can!  We’ve been the venue for weddings, birthdays, memorial ceremonies, company outings, and more.
Contact us
today to start planning your St. Pete Beach event at our welcoming biergarten today!
IN THE NEWS
Thought leadership on
Growing House Beer
programs in FSR Magazine
Cameo of Matt Dahm in the
A Whole Brew World
documentary
Exciting news about the
next stage of growth
for Mastry’s Brewing Co.
Check out our amazing selection of
hand-crafted IPAs, lagers, sours
, and more!
